Description:
Navreh ayi, nayi roshni lai, Har dil khush rahe, ghar mein sukh suhai.
Kashmiri Pandit New Year observed with rituals and prayers to Goddess Sharika; unique to Kashmiri Pandit community.

Mehndi lagai hatho, rangin ho rang birangi, Khushiyan laaye saath mein, ban jaaye din rangangi.
Traditional spring festival involving henna application and folk songs, unique to Kashmiri Pandit culture.

Thand vich gungunahat, Harnai di mehak, Gayan te nachan naal, jindagi vich rang chad.
Winter folk festival specific to Kashmir celebrating local culture through traditional music and dances.

Rooh di awaaz hai, Urs di raat hai, Qawwali di mehfil vich, sab nu baat hai.
Sufi saint commemorative festival held at shrines like Hazratbal, distinct to Kashmir's Sufi heritage.

Sufi di mehfil sajdi, dilaan nu bhaandi, Mehfil vich jashan manaiye, ishq di chaandi.
Sufi shrine festival unique to Kashmir involving devotional qawwali and community feasts.

Lal Ded di vani vich, ruh di shanti mile, Kavita di roshni naal, dard bhi khil jaye.
Cultural-spiritual festival honoring Lal Ded, the mystic poetess, celebrated only in Kashmir.

Amarnath di yatra vich, shraddha di baat hai, Har man di manzil vich, shanti di saath hai.
Hindu pilgrimage to the Amarnath cave in Kashmir, a religious event unique to the region attracting devotees nationwide.

Losar da din aaya, nayi roshni layi, Shanti te khushi naal, jeevan sajaya jai.
Tibetan Buddhist New Year celebrated mainly in Ladakh and Himachal Pradesh, unique to Himalayan Buddhist culture.

Buddha di kirpa naal, man vich sukoon hove, Duniya di roshni vich, pyar hi chhaj jave.
Buddhist festival celebrating birth, enlightenment, and death of Buddha with prayers and feasts.

Guru Nanak ji da charan, sadi zindagi da raah, Prem naal jeevan vich, mile sadaa saah.
Sikh festival marking Guru Nanak Dev Ji's birth anniversary, celebrated with prayers and community kitchens.

Christmas di roshni, sab nu khushi de, Prem te shanti naal, ghar sajaye jaaye.
Christian festival celebrated with church services, decorations, and feasts.

Sundri mundri hoye, Lohri di raat vich, Chiriyan di chah makhi de naal, Giddha te bhangra paayiye saath.
Harvest festival celebrated to mark the end of winter and welcome longer days with bonfires, folk songs, dance, and sweets.

Baisakhi da mela lagda, khetan vich khushiyan jagda, Jatti te Jatt di shaan vich, nachda Punjab sara aan.
Spring harvest festival marking the Punjabi New Year and Sikh community's foundation of Khalsa in 1699.

Maghi aayi, dharti suhani, Sajde ne yaar te jawani.
Festival commemorating the martyrdom of 40 Sikh warriors; celebrated with fairs, community feasts, and prayers.

Teej diyan chhaanv'an vich, suhani jhulan lai ke aayi, Sohni te Mahi da pyar, man diyaan gallan samjhai.
Monsoon festival celebrated by women praying for marital bliss and prosperity, marked by swings, singing, and traditional attire.

Hola Mohalla aaya, Sher Punjab de jithe laya, Gatka te shastar da mela, Sikh virse di pehchaan bhaya.
Sikh festival featuring martial arts displays, poetry, and community gatherings; initiated by Guru Gobind Singh.

Karva Chauth di raat vich, chann nu vekh ke viyakhan, Sohagan di dua naal, rishte sajde dhan dhan.
Fasting ritual observed by married women for the long life of their husbands, marked by prayers and moon sighting.

रंगों का त्योहार है होली, मिल-जुल के मनाएं होली, पुरानी दुश्मनी मिटा के, प्रेम के रंग बिखेरें सभी।
Festival of colors symbolizing the victory of good over evil, celebrated with vibrant color throwing, music, and dance.

गंगोरे की छांव तले, बहनें करें आरती, भाईयों की लंबी उम्र की, करतीं हैं ये प्रार्थना सारी।
Traditional folk festival mainly in rural Haryana, where unmarried girls pray for the long life of their brothers and future husbands.

माखन चोर कृष्ण का जन्मोत्सव, प्रेम और भक्ति से जग सजीव.
Celebration of Lord Krishna's birth with fasting, night vigils, and devotional songs.

सूरजकुंड का मेला है रंगीन, हस्तशिल्प की सौगात लिए, संस्कृति की शान बढ़ाए, हर दिल को ये खुशी दे।
Annual crafts fair held near Faridabad showcasing traditional arts, crafts, and cultural performances unique to Haryana.

कुल्लू दशहरा की रौनक निराली, देवताओं की शोभा और भक्ति भरी बाती।
Unique month-long festival marking victory of good over evil, with grand processions, music, and cultural programs.

मिंजर मेला आया, खुशियों का सैलाब लाया, खेतों की हरियाली और जनता का त्यौहार बताया।
Harvest festival celebrated in Chamba district marking prosperity and offering thanks to the gods.

फागलि के गीत गाओ, बसंती रंग मनाओ, पर्वतों में होली का त्यौहार मनाओ।
Spring festival welcoming the new season with traditional songs, dances, and bonfires.

शूलिनी माता की जय बोलो, खुशियों का मेला मनाओ, पर्वतों की छांव तले प्रेम बांटो।
Festival honoring Goddess Shoolini with processions, fairs, and devotional singing in Solan district.

हलदा के रंग में रंग जाओ, मिट्टी की खुशबू को गाओ, पर्वतों की छांव में त्यौहार मनाओ।
Festival marking the end of harvest season with folk songs, dances, and rituals.

शिव की महिमा गाओ, भक्ति के गीत गाओ, मंडी शिवरात्रि में प्रेम मनाओ।
Celebrated with night-long prayers and cultural fairs dedicated to Lord Shiva in Mandi district.

चैत्र सूकेत मेला सजाओ, देवताओं का आशीर्वाद पाओ।
Cultural fair celebrating local deities with traditional music, dance, and rituals.

राखी के बंधन में स्नेह का प्यार, बहन-भाई का अनोखा त्यौहार।
Celebration of sibling bonds where sisters tie rakhi on brothers' wrists and pray for their well-being.

स्नान के संग पाप धुलें, कुंभ में हो अमृत बरसें।
One of the largest religious gatherings in the world, held at Haridwar (Uttarakhand) and Prayagraj (Uttar Pradesh), attracting millions for holy dips in the river.

नंदा देवी की माया छाई, पर्वतों में खुशहाली लाई।
Annual festival honoring Goddess Nanda Devi with rituals, fairs, and cultural programs in the Garhwal region.

मकर संक्रांति आई, पतंगों का रंग छाई।
Harvest festival marked by kite flying, feasts, and prayers for prosperity.

फूल देई का त्योहार, बसंत की खुशबू लाई बार-बार।
Spring festival where girls go door-to-door to bless houses with flowers and songs.

सरस्वती मां की आरती उतारो, विद्या के दीप जलाओ।
Festival celebrating Goddess Saraswati, goddess of knowledge, with prayers and cultural activities.

गंगा माता की पवित्र छाया, पापों को करे हराया।
Celebrates the descent of the River Ganges to Earth, with holy dips and rituals.

हरेला त्योहार, प्रकृति का उपहार, खेती की खुशहाली का उद्धार।
Agricultural festival marking the onset of monsoon and new crop sowing, with tree planting and prayers.

राम नाम का जप लगाओ, जीवन में खुशियाँ लाओ।
Birth anniversary of Lord Rama celebrated with prayers and recitations of the Ramayana.

दीपों की रौशनी से जगमगाए, अंधकार मिटाए, सुख समृद्धि लाए।
Festival of lights marking the victory of good over evil, celebrated with lamps, fireworks, and sweets.

रोज़े की खुशियाँ, ईद की नमाज़ें, दिलों में मोहब्बत की परछाइयां।
Festival marking the end of Ramadan, celebrated with prayers, feasts, and giving charity.

अहिंसा का संदेश फैलाए, महावीर की जय गाए।
Celebrates the birth of Lord Mahavir, founder of Jainism, with prayers and charitable activities.

गरबा की थाप, नवरात्रि का जोश, हर दिल में उत्सव का मौसाम।
Nine-night festival celebrating Goddess Durga with traditional Garba and Dandiya dances, vibrant attire, and devotional songs.

पतंगों का त्योहार, आसमान रंगीन, खुशियाँ हर घर में सींमित।
Harvest festival famous for massive kite-flying competitions, feasts, and social gatherings marking the sun's northward journey.

थार की रेत पर रंग बिरंगा मेला, संस्कृति की झलक हर कोना।
Cultural festival in the Rann of Kutch showcasing folk music, dance, crafts, and local traditions in a desert setting.

रावण दहन की अग्नि में, बुराई का अंत हुआ निश्चित।
Festival marking the victory of Lord Rama over Ravana, celebrated with processions, effigy burning, and cultural programs.

चाँद की चाँदनी में खुशियाँ छुपाए, शरद पूर्णिमा का त्योहार मनाए।
Harvest festival celebrated on the full moon night with prayers and night-long celebrations under moonlight.

टर्नेटर मेला, रंगीन परिधान, लोक संस्कृति की शान।
Famous tribal fair known for traditional dance, music, and matchmaking ceremonies held near Surendranagar.

दुर्गा की भक्ति से भरा बसेरा, बस्तर का त्योहार है अनोखा सवेरा।
Unique 75-day long Dussehra celebrated with tribal rituals, processions, and cultural performances in Bastar region.

भोपाल के संगम पर, मेलों का रंग चढ़ा, संस्कृति की छटा फैली।
Annual fair near Bhojpur Temple featuring folk dances, music, and religious rituals attracting locals and tourists.

नृत्य की छटा बिखेरती, खजुराहो की रजाई।
Cultural festival showcasing classical Indian dance forms at Khajuraho temples with spectacular performances.

राजिम कुंभ का मेला, धर्म और आस्था का बसेरा।
Religious festival held at Rajim, involving holy dips, rituals, and cultural events similar to Kumbh Mela.

गोंडवाना की संस्कृति में छुपा, त्योहारों का संगम बसा।
Festival celebrating the culture, art, and heritage of the Gond tribal community with music and dance.

सूरज देवता की आराधना, छठ पूजा का सुहाना मेला।
Major festival dedicated to the Sun God and Chhathi Maiya, involving rigorous fasting, holy dips, and evening and morning prayers on riverbanks.

भाइयों की छांव तले, बहनों का त्योहार मनाए।
Folk festival celebrating brother-sister relationships with traditional songs, rituals, and colorful decorations symbolizing the bond of love.

भारत का सबसे बड़ा मेला, संस्कृति का अनमोल खजाना।
Asia's largest cattle fair held annually with livestock trading, cultural events, and religious activities.

माँ दुर्गा की जयकार, बुरी शक्तियों का संहार।
Festival celebrating Goddess Durga's victory over evil, with elaborate pandals, rituals, and cultural programs.

शिव शंभु की भक्ति में, रात जागे भक्त जन।
Night-long festival honoring Lord Shiva with fasting, prayers, and special rituals at temples.

ज्ञान और विद्या की देवी का आह्वान।
Celebration in honor of Goddess Saraswati, marking the start of the academic year with prayers for wisdom and learning.

करमा के रंग में झूमे गाँव-दीहात, प्रकृति के गीत गाए।
Tribal festival celebrating nature worship and the Karma tree, featuring folk dances, songs, and community feasts.

तुसू मेला, खुशियों की बयार, संस्कृति का प्यारा त्योहार।
Harvest festival celebrated by tribal women with folk songs and dances, marking the end of the agricultural season.

सारुल की पूजा में बसा है जीवन, पेड़ों की छाँव में है उत्सव का गीत।
Tribal New Year and nature worship festival, honoring trees and nature spirits with rituals, dances, and songs.

माँ की ममता, जतिया के व्रत में झलकती।
Fasting festival by mothers praying for the long life and health of their children, observed with rituals and prayers.

करमा के पत्तों में छुपा है सांस्कृतिक संग, खुशियों का रंग।
Worship of Karam tree by tribal communities seeking blessings for good harvest and prosperity.

राम नाम की माला, मन में भक्ति की छाला।
Celebration of Lord Rama’s birth with devotional songs, processions, and religious ceremonies.

दीपों की चमक से जगमगाए घर, खुशियों से भरे हर एक नगर।
Festival of lights symbolizing victory of good over evil, celebrated with lamps, fireworks, and sweets.

सूरज देव की आराधना, छठ पूजा का पावन त्यौहार।
Major festival dedicated to the Sun God involving fasting, holy baths, and prayers on riverbanks, especially among Maithil and tribal communities.

खुशियों का सैलाब, बैसाखी का त्योहार।
Harvest festival celebrated with traditional dances, fairs, and prayers marking the Punjabi New Year and beginning of the harvest season.

दीपों की रौशनी से जगमगाए दिल्ली की गलियां।
Festival of lights symbolizing victory of good over evil, celebrated with lamps, fireworks, and family gatherings.

रंगों की बारिश में भीग जाए दिल्ली का हर गली-मोहल्ला।
Festival of colors celebrated with vibrant colors, music, dance, and community fun.

रोज़े खत्म, खुशियों की बहार, ईद का त्यौहार।
Festival marking the end of Ramadan, celebrated with prayers, feasts, and social gatherings among Muslim communities.

क्रिसमस की रोशनी में जगमगाए दिल और शहर।
Celebration of the birth of Jesus Christ with carols, decorations, and community events.

गुरु नानक की महिमा से भरा, प्रकाश पर्व मनाया।
Birthday of Guru Nanak Dev Ji, founder of Sikhism, marked with prayers, processions, and community kitchens (Langar).

लोहड़ी की आग में जले सुख-दुख सारे।
Traditional Punjabi festival celebrated with bonfires, singing, and dancing marking the end of winter and arrival of longer days.

रिश्तों की डोर, भाई-बहन का प्यार।
Festival celebrating the bond between brothers and sisters, where sisters tie a protective thread (Rakhi) on brothers' wrists.

गणपति बप्पा मोरया, हर दिल में बसे है माया।
Celebration of Lord Ganesha’s birth with prayers, processions, and immersion of idols.

भगवान जगन्नाथ का रथ निकले, श्रद्धा और भक्ति से मन झूले।
Grand chariot festival in Puri where deities Jagannath, Balabhadra, and Subhadra are pulled through the streets amidst huge crowds and celebrations.

सांस्कृतिक रंगों का संगम, सांबलपुर में उत्सव का आलम।
Folk festival showcasing tribal dances, music, crafts, and cuisine celebrating Odisha's diverse tribal heritage.

छाऊ नृत्य की धूम, प्रकृति का संगीत बहुम।
Traditional masked dance festival blending martial arts and folk traditions, held in Mayurbhanj and neighboring areas.

मकर मेला में उमड़े भक्त, उमंगों से भरा हर एक महाक।
Religious fair held at Lingaraj Temple attracting devotees with rituals, shopping, and cultural events.

बाली यात्रा की धूम, नावों से सजी सड़कों में गूंज।
Festival commemorating ancient maritime trade, featuring boat-shaped stalls, cultural programs, and fairs.

रंगों की बहार, प्रेम के त्यौहार।
Festival of colors similar to Holi, celebrated with singing, dancing, and processions honoring Lord Krishna.

हिरकुद की महिमा, संस्कृति की जीवंत धारा।
Festival celebrating the construction and importance of Hirakud Dam with cultural events and fairs.

नए अन्न का स्वागत, घर-घर खुशियों का वास।
Harvest festival where new rice is eaten for the first time of the season, marking gratitude for a good harvest.

মা দুর্গার আগমন, বাংলার প্রাণের উৎসব।
The grandest festival of West Bengal, celebrating Goddess Durga's victory over evil with elaborate pandals, cultural programs, and community feasts.

নতুন বছরের শুরু, নতুন আশা ও আনন্দের ঝড়।
Bengali New Year marked by cultural events, new clothes, and festive gatherings to welcome prosperity and happiness.

কালী মায়ের ভক্তি, অন্ধকারে আলো জ্বেলে রাখে।
Festival dedicated to Goddess Kali, celebrated with night-long prayers, lamps, and fireworks, especially in Kolkata and surrounding areas.

জ্ঞান দেবী সরস্বতীর আরাধনা, বিদ্যার উৎসব।
Celebration honoring Goddess Saraswati, the goddess of knowledge, with prayers, cultural programs, and school events.

রথযাত্রার রঙিন মেলা, ভক্তদের ভিড় এবং আনন্দ।
Annual chariot festival of Lord Jagannath, celebrated with processions and festivities unique to the Mahesh area.

জগদ্ধাত্রী মা’র পূজা, ঐতিহ্যের দীপ প্রজ্জ্বলন।
Festival honoring Goddess Jagadhatri, celebrated with grandeur especially in Chandannagar with lights, rituals, and cultural shows.

নবান্ন উৎসব, ফসলের আনন্দ এবং ধান্যতার গান।
Harvest festival celebrating the new rice crop with folk dances, feasts, and rural fairs in Bengal's villages.

বিশ্বকর্মার আরাধনা, কারিগরদের উৎসব।
Festival honoring Lord Vishwakarma, the divine architect, celebrated by artisans, craftsmen, and factory workers.

বিহুৰ ৰঙত ভৰপূৰ, গাঁও-গাঁৱৰ উৎসৱ।
Major Assamese harvest festival celebrating new year with folk dances, songs, feasts, and community gatherings.

নতুন বসনৰ উজ্জ্বলতা, নতুন আশাৰ শুভাৰম্ভ।
The spring version of Bihu marking the Assamese New Year with vibrant cultural events and joyous celebrations.

ভোগালী বিহু, আনন্দৰ উৎসৱ, খেতি-বৰ্মা ধানৰ উৎসৱ।
Harvest festival in January featuring feasts, bonfires, and traditional games marking the end of the harvesting season.

কাটি বিহুৰ সোৱণীয়া ৰাতি, দীপালিৰ পোহৰ।
Festival of lights marking the time of crop protection, with lamps lit in fields and homes for prosperity.

আলী আই লিগাংত, নৃত্যগীতৰ ৰমণীয়তা।
Spring festival of the Mising tribe involving folk dance, music, and community feasts welcoming the sowing season.

জনবিল মেলাৰ বাণিজ্য, সংস্কৃতিৰ মিলন।
Traditional fair featuring barter trade among communities, with cultural performances and rituals.

দেহিং পাতকাইৰ জংঘলৰ উৎসৱ, প্ৰকৃতিৰ সন্মান।
Festival celebrating the rich biodiversity of the Dehing Patkai rainforest with cultural programs and eco-tourism promotion.

অম্বুবাচী মেলাত, ভক্তিৰ অমিয়া ঢৌ।
Annual festival at Kamakhya Temple marking the goddess's menstruation period, with devotees gathering for special rituals.

गणपती बाप्पा मोरया, पुढे येऊ नक्की!
The grand festival celebrating Lord Ganesha’s birth with large public and private celebrations, idol installations, processions, and immersions.

गुढी उभारू नववर्ष साजरा करू!
Maharashtrian New Year marked by raising the Gudi flag, feasting, and welcoming new beginnings with joy and prayers.

सकाळच्या सुर्याची मंद चांगली शपथ!
Harvest festival celebrated with kite flying, sweets made of jaggery and sesame, marking the sun’s northward journey.

भिमाशंकर दर्शनाने मन आनंदित होई!
Pilgrimage to the Bhimashankar temple, one of the twelve Jyotirlingas, attracting devotees from across the state.

नाग देवतेच्या पूजा करु, सापांचा आदर करू!
Festival honoring snakes with rituals, offerings, and worship to seek protection and blessings.

शिमगा रंगांचा उत्सव, मस्ती आणि आनंद!
Maharashtrian version of Holi, celebrated with bonfires, singing, dancing, and throwing colors.

तुळशी विवाहाचा शुभ मुहूर्त, मंगलमय जीवनाचा प्रारंभ!
Marriage ceremony of the Tulsi plant with Lord Vishnu’s avatar, symbolizing prosperity and spiritual harmony.

शिवाजी महाराजांची जयंत, वीरतेची गाथा!
Birth anniversary of the great Maratha king celebrated with cultural programs and patriotic fervor.

ఉగాది పండుగలో కొత్త ఆశలు, సంతోషాలు పుట్టుకొస్తాయి!
Telugu New Year celebrated with special rituals, mango leaves decorations, and traditional Ugadi Pachadi symbolizing life’s flavors.

సంక్రాంతి పండుగలో సూర్యుడికి నమస్కారం, పల్లెలో ఉత్సవం!
Harvest festival marked by kite flying, bonfires, and feasts celebrating the sun's northward journey and agricultural prosperity.

వినాయకుడికి పూజలు, సంతోషాల పర్వదినం!
Festival dedicated to Lord Ganesha with idol installations, prayers, and community celebrations across Andhra Pradesh.

సంక్రాంతి సంబరాలు, పొంగల్ వంటలు!
Harvest festival where people prepare 'Pongal' and celebrate with dances and fairs unique to Andhra culture.

కార్తీక మాసం పూజలు, దీపాల వెలుగులు!
Month-long festival dedicated to Lord Vishnu and Shiva, observed with lighting lamps and holy rituals at temples and homes.

పుష్కరాలులో పవిత్ర గంగ, పుణ్యస్నానం!
Special river festival celebrated every 12 years, attracting devotees for holy dips in the rivers to cleanse sins.

బోనాలు తియ్యగా, భక్తి పరవశం!
Though mainly Telangana, also observed in parts of Andhra, dedicated to Goddess Mahakali with offerings, dances, and rituals for protection and prosperity.

ಮೈಸೂರು ದಸರಾ, ವಿಜಯದ ಹಬ್ಬ!
The royal festival celebrating Goddess Chamundeshwari’s victory over evil, famous for grand processions, cultural performances, and illumination of Mysore Palace.

ಉಗಾದಿ ಹಬ್ಬ, ಹೊಸ ವರ್ಷಕ್ಕೆ ಹೊಸ ಆಶಗಳು!
Kannada New Year marked with special dishes like ‘Bevu Bella’ symbolizing life’s bittersweet experiences, and rituals to welcome prosperity.

ಕಾರಾಗಾ ಹಬ್ಬ, ಸಾಂಪ್ರದಾಯಿಕ ಜಾತ್ರೆ!
Ancient folk festival dedicated to Goddess Draupadi featuring a night procession with the bearer carrying a decorated floral pyramid on the head.

ಹಂಪಿ ಹಬ್ಬ, ವಿಜಯನಗರ ಸ್ಮರಣೆ!
Cultural festival celebrating the heritage of the Vijayanagara Empire with music, dance, and heritage walks in the historic ruins.

ಕಂಬಳದ ಸ್ಪರ್ಧೆ, ನೈಸರ್ಗಿಕ ಕ್ರೀಡೆ!
Traditional buffalo race held in paddy fields as thanksgiving for a good harvest and entertainment.

ನಾಗಮಂಡಳ, ನೃತ್ಯ ಮತ್ತು ನಾಟಕದ ಸಂಭ್ರಮ!
Folk ritualistic dance-drama dedicated to serpent worship, involving vibrant costumes and storytelling.

ವೈರಮುದಿ ಹಬ್ಬ, ದೇವರ ಔಭರಣೋತ್ಸವ!
Annual festival in Melukote where the deity Cheluvanarayana Swamy is adorned with a diamond-studded crown (Vairamudi) and grand celebrations take place.

பொங்கலோ பொங்கல்! விதைகள் கனியாக, வாழ்வில் வளமாக!
Four-day harvest festival thanking the Sun God and cattle, celebrated with boiling the first rice of the season and decorating homes with kolams.

கந்தா வாழ்க! பக்தியில் துளியும் சோறு போதாதே!
Dedicated to Lord Murugan, devotees carry 'kavadi' in pilgrimage and perform acts of devotion and penance.

ஆடி பெருக்கு வரவோ நதி வாழ்வோ!
Celebration of life and water’s abundance, observed by women offering prayers to rivers for prosperity and fertility.

கார்த்திகை தீபம், ஒரு தீபம் வீடெல்லாம்!
Festival of lights where rows of oil lamps are lit in homes and temples, culminating in the lighting of the giant beacon atop Tiruvannamalai hill.

மீனாட்சி திருக்கல்யாணம், மதுரையின் மகிழ்ச்சி!
Marks the celestial wedding of Goddess Meenakshi and Lord Sundareswarar with grand processions and temple rituals in Madurai.

மகாமகம் புனித நீராடல், பாவம் போக்கும் பரிசு!
Mass spiritual bathing festival celebrated in Kumbakonam’s Mahamaham tank, considered sacred like the Kumbh Mela.

நடனத்தினால் நாதனைத் தொழுது வாழ்வு!
Dance festival paying homage to Lord Nataraja through classical performances by Bharatanatyam artists in the Chidambaram temple.

यहाँ दशहरा नहीं, आस्था का महासागर बहता है!
Unlike elsewhere, Bastar Dussehra honors local deities like Danteshwari Mata with 75-day-long tribal rituals, processions, and deep devotion.

धनुष-बाण से खेलें पर्व, प्रेम से मनाएं धर्म!
Tribals celebrate Lord Jagannath by mock-fighting with bamboo bows and fruit bullets, reflecting joy and brotherhood.

हल चलाओ, हरियाली लाओ!
Celebrated by farmers to honor nature and agriculture, tools are worshipped, and children play traditional games like 'Gedi' (bamboo stilts).

मड़ई में उमड़ता है लोकजीवन का रंग!
A tribal fair where deities are taken out in processions; includes folk music, dance, and rituals that travel from village to village.

तीजा व्रत से माँग का सिंदूर गाढ़ा होता है!
Women observe fasts for marital bliss, singing traditional songs and swinging on decorated swings during the Shravan month.

वल्लभाचार्य की जन्मभूमि, भक्ति से सराबोर भूमि!
Celebrates the birth of Saint Vallabhacharya with bhajans, satsangs, and large religious gatherings at Champaran.

बैल पूजन, खेतों की जान का अभिनंदन!
Festival where farmers worship their bulls, decorate them, and thank them for their role in farming, followed by races and feasts.

प्यारा गोवा, नाचो-गाओ, रंगों में खो जाओ!
Pre-Lenten festival with vibrant parades, music, dancing, and floats, where King Momo leads the festivities in a spirit of joy and indulgence.

सांव जोआओ, कुओं में कूदो, खुशी में डूबो!
A monsoon festival honoring St. John the Baptist, where young men jump into wells and ponds wearing floral crowns in a joyful water celebration.

झंडों की लड़ाई, प्यार की छांव!
Colorful festival commemorating historical land disputes on Divar Island with mock battles using flags, floats, music, and carnival spirit.

शिगमो आई रे! ढोल-नगाड़ों की गूंज सुनाई दे!
Goa’s traditional spring festival celebrated with folk dances, vibrant processions, and colors, honoring warriors and nature's rebirth.

संत का पर्व, श्रद्धा की लहर!
Held at Basilica of Bom Jesus, this festival honors Goa's patron saint with mass prayers, pilgrimages, and a grand fair attracting thousands.

मिट्टी में मस्ती, भक्ति में शक्ति!
A unique mud festival where locals play games in wet soil, re-enacting Lord Krishna’s childhood while celebrating community bonding.

शांतादुर्गा आई, भक्तों की भीड़ लाई!
A grand temple fair celebrating Goddess Shantadurga with palanquins, traditional rituals, and devotional music in Goa’s Hindu temples.

रंगों में रमता मणिपुर, याओशांग लाए भक्ति और मस्ती!
Manipur’s version of Holi, celebrated with Thabal Chongba (moonlight dance), sports, and cultural programs over five days, blending joy and spirituality.

ईश्वरीय नृत्य, संस्कृति की पूजा!
Festival honoring traditional deities with ritual dances, music, and storytelling performed by Maibis (priestesses), showcasing creation myths of the Meiteis.

बहनों के नाम दावत, भाईयों के दिल से प्यार!
A family reunion festival where married women are invited by their parents for a grand feast, celebrating the bond between brothers and sisters.

कृष्ण की रथयात्रा, श्रद्धा और सजावट का संगम!
Rath Yatra celebrated by the Vaishnavite Meitei community, involving a nine-day procession of Lord Govindaji’s chariot with devotional songs and offerings.

नया साल, नई उम्मीदें, नई ऊँचाइयाँ!
Meitei New Year celebrated with cleaning homes, offering traditional dishes to deities, and symbolic hill-climbing to mark personal growth and renewal.

नावों की रेस, आस्था की बूँदों में विश्वास!
A traditional boat race festival celebrated on a sacred moat with religious rituals, symbolizing unity and spiritual merit in the Meitei culture.

फसल की खुशी, जनजातीय रंगीनी!
A harvest festival celebrated by Kuki-Chin-Mizo tribes with folk dances, songs, traditional games, and community feasting in joy and gratitude.

नृत्य है आराधना, परंपरा की आत्मा!
Khasi thanksgiving festival where men and women in traditional attire dance to drumbeats to honor ancestors and seasonal abundance.

बजाओ ड्रम, गाओ धन्यवाद!
Garo harvest festival where 100 drums (Nokma) are beaten in rhythm to please the Sun God, featuring dance, music, and food.

बीमारियों को बहाओ, समृद्धि को बुलाओ!
A Jaintia festival to ward off diseases with rituals, symbolic logs, dance, and traditional games for a prosperous community.

झूम की थकान, उत्सव की पहचान!
Spring festival after jungle clearing for farming; celebrated with bamboo dance (Cheraw), folk songs, and vibrant attire.

मक्का की फसल, पूर्वजों की याद!
Harvest festival dedicated to ancestors, involving offerings of maize, wine, and songs to honor their spirits.

अन्न की पूजा, उत्सव की माया!
Thanksgiving after rice harvest with family feasts, community dances, and children’s blessings—a vital cultural tradition.

नगा संस्कृति का रंगारंग संगम!
‘Festival of Festivals’ showcasing all Naga tribes with traditional games, dances, food, and crafts in a cultural extravaganza.

खेती के बाद मस्ती की बौछार!
Celebrated after sowing season with Ao Naga songs, dances, and brewing of traditional rice beer in joy and hope.

शुद्धि का पर्व, परंपरा का गौरव!
Angami cleansing festival involving rituals of purification, feasts, and age-group activities marking moral and physical renewal.

नया साल, नई रौशनी!
Tibetan New Year celebrated with prayers, cham (masked) dances, and rituals in monasteries like Rumtek to usher prosperity and harmony.

कंचनजंघा की पूजा, भाईचारे की भावना!
Unique to Sikkim, this festival venerates Mt. Kanchenjunga and the guardian deities with warrior dances and communal prayers.

ध्यान और दया का महोत्सव!
Celebrates birth, enlightenment, and death of Buddha with processions, butter lamps, and offerings in Buddhist monasteries.

देवी-देवताओं की विशेष पूजा!
A major tribal Hindu festival where 14 deities are worshipped with rituals, followed by a week-long fair with cultural performances.

गेरिया देवता, फसल और खुशी लाओ!
A tribal festival to appease the deity of livestock and prosperity with songs, bamboo dance, and symbolic animal sacrifice.

नियम और निष्ठा से पूजन!
Conducted to protect the state from calamities, this highly disciplined festival restricts movement and activities for spiritual focus.
